knowledge.what is html stands: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language. It is the standard language used to create web pages and web applications.
knowledge.what are html tags: HTML tags are elements used to define the structure and content of a web page. They are enclosed in angle brackets, like <tag> and usually come in pairs, with an opening tag <tag> and a closing tag </tag>.
knowledge.what is an html element:
An HTML element is a component of a web page defined by HTML tags. For example,

This is a paragraph

is an HTML paragraph element.
knowledge.what is the purpose of the <html> tag: The <html> tag represents the root of an HTML document. All other HTML elements are contained within this tag.
knowledge.what does the <head> tag do: The <head> tag contains meta-information about the HTML document, such as the title, character set, styles, and linked resources. This section is not displayed on the webpage.
knowledge.what does the <title> tag do: The <title> tag defines the title of the HTML document, which appears in the browser's title bar or tab.
knowledge.what is the <body> tag used for: The <body> tag defines the main content of the HTML document that is visible to users in the browser.
knowledge.what is an html attribute: An HTML attribute provides additional information about an HTML element, usually within the opening tag, like Link. 'href' is an attribute of the tag.
knowledge.what is the <a> tag used for: The <a> tag is used to create hyperlinks, which allow users to navigate from one page to another.
knowledge.what does the <img> tag do: The tag is used to embed images in an HTML page. It has attributes like 'src' to specify the image source and 'alt' to provide alternative text.
knowledge.what is the purpose of the <div> tag: The <div> tag is a block-level container used to group HTML elements together, often for styling or layout purposes.
knowledge.what is the difference between <div> and: <div> is a block-level element used for grouping large sections of content, while <span> is an inline element used for grouping smaller portions of text within a line.
knowledge.what is the <form> tag used for: The <form> tag is used to create an HTML form for user input. It can contain form elements like text fields, checkboxes, and submit buttons.
knowledge.what does the <input> tag do: The <input> tag is used to create interactive fields in a form, like text fields, checkboxes, and radio buttons. It has attributes such as 'type' to specify the kind of input field.
knowledge.what is the <table> tag used for: The <table> tag is used to create a table in HTML. It is composed of rows (<tr>) and cells (<td> for data cells and <th> for header cells).
